MCP System

Multi-Client Protocol for LLM Collaboration

A collaborative website development platform that leverages Claude and ChatGPT as autonomous agents, with one acting as a Builder and the other as a Judge.

Learn More Get Started

Key Features

Dual-Agent Architecture

Utilizes both Claude and ChatGPT in complementary roles, with one as the Builder generating code and design solutions, and the other as the Judge evaluating and critiquing.

Role Switching

Dynamically swap Builder and Judge roles between LLMs to leverage the unique strengths of each model for different aspects of website development.

Persistent Memory

Maintains conversation history and context across sessions, allowing for continuous development and iteration on website projects.

Token Optimization

Intelligently manages context windows for optimal performance, using techniques like summarization and memory anchors to maximize token efficiency.

Real-time Communication

Socket.io integration for immediate agent responses, creating a seamless collaborative experience between you and the AI agents.

Project Management

Create and manage multiple website development projects, with organized tracking of progress and deliverables for each project.

How It Works

Builder Agent

The Builder agent (Claude or ChatGPT) generates code, designs, and implementation suggestions based on your requirements.

  • Creates HTML, CSS, and JavaScript code
  • Proposes design solutions and layouts
  • Implements requested features and functionality

Judge Agent

The Judge agent evaluates and critiques the Builder's work, providing feedback and suggestions for improvement.

  • Reviews code for bugs and best practices
  • Assesses design for usability and aesthetics
  • Suggests improvements and alternative approaches
